data.text:
In the book No Country For Old Men they use a setting set in a desolate country area of Texas. Throughout the book you see how the characters interact with the environment and how the setting works as a symbol for the theme. In No Country for Old Men the country setting is used as a symbol for the ignorance of the characters and how they don't understand is truly going on. In No Country Moss is a character that is very ignorant to what he has started and how he thinks he can still be in control. This plays into the setting because a setting in the country is a symbol of ignorance and primitivism. This is shown in Moss by him thinking that he could get away with stealing the money with no repercussions. It also shows how truly unequipped he is to even attempt to fight off Chigurh. Moss is a retired blacksmith who has never dealt with the shade drug dealing world of criminals, yet he thinks because he knows how to shoot a gun that he can make it work. This ignorance leads to his downfall which is shown through the setting. …show more content…

Not only does he not have the necessary tools to take on Chigurh and is constantly behind, he is also not capable mentally. He says that he is scared to meet the person responsible for all this death. He also shows ignorance in the fact that he thinks that Moss wants to be saved, he believes Moss needs help while at the same time Moss believes he has it under control.
